not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less

willow

lit. you plant a garden and the flowers do not bloom, you poke a stick in the mud and it grows into a tree/fig. things do not always turn out as one would expect/well-laid plans may fail, and success may come where you least expect it
pinyin: you3 yi4 zai1 hua1 hua1 bu4 fa1 , wu2 xin1 cha1 liu3 liu3 cheng2 yin1
containing_words.word: 有意栽花花不发，无心插柳柳成阴

definition: lit. idly poke a stick in the mud and it grows into a tree to shade you/(fig.) unintentional actions may bring unexpected success/also written 無心插柳柳成蔭|无心插柳柳成荫
pinyin: wu2 xin1 cha1 liu3 liu3 cheng2 yin1

sentences.english: A so huge business however only then insert willow involuntarily at oneself.
sentences.chinese: 这样庞大的一个业务却始自于一次无心插柳。

definition: to succeed by a lucky stroke
accidentally/to act before thinking
the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: lit. the spring comes upon a withered tree (idiom)/fig. to get a new lease on life/to be revived/(of a difficult situation) to suddenly improve

a blind cat finds a dead mouse (idiom)/blind luck

God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
